description: Find out how much Chicago buildings pollute! This public tool helps citizens understand building emissions in the city.
Built with a modern Jamstack approach using Gridsome and Vue.

hero.alt: a screenshot of the front page of the electrify chicago project

tech_stack.name: Vue.js
tech_stack.tooltip: Progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces.

tech_stack.name: Gridsome
tech_stack.tooltip: Vue-powered static site generator optimized for performance and SEO.

tech_stack.name: Typescript
tech_stack.tooltip: Superset of JavaScript that adds static typing and modern features.

tech_stack.name: Python
tech_stack.tooltip: Versatile, high-level programming language known for its readability and wide use across data science, web development, and automation.

tech_stack.name: GraphQL
tech_stack.tooltip: Query language for APIs that allows clients to request exactly the data they need.

tech_stack.name: Pandas
tech_stack.tooltip: Powerful Python library for data manipulation and analysis.

tech_stack.name: D3.js
tech_stack.tooltip: JavaScript library for bespoke data visualization.

tech_stack.name: Sass
tech_stack.tooltip: CSS preprocessor that adds features like variables, nesting, and mixins to regular CSS.

text.information: We sourced emissions data from public records and aggregated them using Python and Pandas. The data pipeline ensures regular updates and accuracy.
The front-end allows users to search, filter, and explore emissions by neighborhood or building. Performance and clarity were a top priority.
